page.title: 09GUSTON VILLAGE LIFE
page.content: Most of the villagers work in Dover but some farther afield ,one commuting to London. 90% go to work by car. The 460 acre Guston Court Farm lies in the oldest part of the village. A family farm changed little since Britain joined the E.E.C. 200 acres produce cereals,130 acres produce hay and the rest is used for 125 dairy cows. A fire in October destroyed the 6 bay Dutch Barn causing damage estimated at Â£30,000. The whole farm is run by 3 people with 110hp tractor and a combined harvester. The village still has its pub "The Chance" with its skittle alley. Little else brings the community together. Residents are fond of their quiet village but they are concerned about the community's decline. Particular worries at this time are vandalism, littering and the infrequent bus service.
